patterns: How do i protect Bitter Gourd
responses:
1) Farm yard manure : 10 tons/acre 
 2)Chemical fertilizers (kg/acre): N : P : K : 25: 20: 20 
 3)Top dressing: Apply 50% of N 4 weeks after transplanting and earth up the crodiv.

patterns: what crops i can grow in my red soil
what are the best crops in red soil
responses: crops suitable in red soil : cotton,wheat,rice,pulses,millets,tobacco,oilseeds,potatoes,fruits,groundnut, maize, soyabean, greengram, redgram, jute,tea, coca,grapes,papaya and mango.

patterns: what crops i can grow in my Black soil

responses: crops suitable in black soil : Certain crops include maize, Jowar, millets, linseed, tobacco, safflower, sugar cane, vegetables, and so on like coconut, cashew, and casuarinas in high-rainfall areas.

patterns: when to cut down the bananas
responses: Bananas are ready to be picked when they look well rounded with ribs, and the little flowers at the end are dry and rub off easily. You can pick them now, green, and they will start ripening as soon as you pick them, no matter their size.

patterns: how to preserve bananas for long time
responses: You can preserve bananas for use in cooking and baking by peeling and freezing them. Or, to preserve them for eating, peel, split in half lengthwise and dry them.

patterns: can i grow crops with less water
what are the crops i can grow with less water
crops which need very less water
responses: With less water we can grow sorghum and 5 types of millet (pearl millet, foxtail, proso, finger and little). All are suitable for growth in drought conditions. Other commercial non-grain crops suitable for drylands include cassava, sweet potatoes, various beans and peanuts.

patterns: how frequently i must irrigate my crop
how frequently i must irrigate rice Crop
how frequently i must irrigate Wheat Crop
responses: if it is rainy season you can irrigate your crop twice a month, if it is summer you must irrigate at least 4 times a month.

patterns: what are the irrigation techniques i can adopt to get good yeild
which is the best irrigation technique
responses:
There are mainy two types of irrigation techniqus
 1) drip irrigation : suitable for long term crops like mango, coconut, Brinjal and banana. 
 2) sprinkler irrigation : suitable for short term crops like raagi,wheat and onion

responses:
1) Farm yard manure : 10 tons/acre

Generally well decomposed FYM (15-20 t/ha) is mixed with the soil during ploughing. The recommended dose of fertilizer to be applied per hectare is 50-100 kg N, 40-60 kg P2O5 and 30-60 kg 25 K2O. Half the N and entire P & K should be applied before planting.

patterns: what are loan plan for farmers
can i get loan to grow fruits,flowers
can i get loan from banks
responses:
1)State Bank of India (SBI) gives : Crop Loan,Kisan Credit Card (KCC),Drip Irrigation Loan,Combine Harvestor.
 2)ICICI Bank gives:  Retail Agricultural Loan,Long Term Agricultural Loan.-Central Bank of India gives : Cent Kisan Tatkal Scheme,Cent Vermicompost Scheme,Cent Solar Water Heater Scheme,Kisan Credit Card.
 3)Union Bank gives : Crop Loan,Union Gold Loan,Kisan Credit Card,Bio Gas Loan,Farm Mechanization Loan.
 4)Axis Bank gives: Kisan Power,Kisan Matsya,Kisan Mitra,AGPRO Power.
 5)National Bank or Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) has : Agriclinic and Agribusiness Centres Scheme,National Livestock Mission,New Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure for more information please contact kisan helpline or visit :https://www.paisabazaar.com/personal-loan/agriculture-loan/
